channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How ‘day zero’ water shortages in Iran are fuelling protests
item.description: Supply failures dramatic example of how climate crisis threatens basic human need – and with it political stability Iran protests – live updates Gripp...

item.title: Growth figures give boost to Reeves – but it’s too early to get carried away
item.description: While better-than-expected data for November offers hope for UK economy, clouds remain on the horizon • UK economy grew by better-than-expected despit...

item.title: Iran says protester Erfan Soltani not sentenced to death as it reopens its airspace – live
item.description: Iranian state media quotes judiciary as saying Soltani not given death sentence, after family earlier told his execution had been postponed Trump has ...

item.title: Why big oil giants may not rush to buy into Donald Trump’s Venezuelan vision
item.description: It may well be safer, easier and cheaper for US companies to procure whatever oil the US economy needs at home There are a few reasons that Donald Tru...

item.title: Trump to meet Venezuelan opposition leader and Nobel peace laureate Maria Corina Machado later – US politics live
item.description: Trump and his top advisers have previously hinted at their willingness to work with acting president Delcy Rodríguez Hello and welcome to the US polit...

item.title: UK 'considering options' as Russia expels British diplomat over spy claims
item.description: Moscow has accused the unidentified man of being an undercover spy working at the British embassy in Moscow.

item.title: Millions of people to see their local council elections delayed
item.description: Most wanting a delay are Labour-led but two are Tory councils and one is a Lib Dem authority.

item.title: UK economy grew by 0.3% in November, beating forecasts
item.description: The economy was boosted by a rebound in car production and from the services sector.

item.title: Olivia Dean, Central Cee and Little Simz lead 2026 Mobo nominations
item.description: The musicians pick up four nominations each, as the ceremony moves to Manchester for the first time.

item.title: Federal agent shoots Minneapolis man in leg after attack, officials say
item.description: The agent was acting in self-defence after being attacked with a shovel, said the Department of Homeland Security.
